data.title: Very good German cuisine
data.text:
We had dinner with friends recently at Main Street and we enjoyed the Octoberfest atmosphere.  I ordered the sauerbraten and it was very good.  My wife ordered pork medallions and she enjoyed the meal, but we were disappointed with the quality of the spaetzle.

The German beers are an added plus and the desserts were outstanding.

data.title: Great Dinner!
data.text:
What a wonderful gem to discover!  We did plan ahead and made dinner reservations, and were seated promptly.  Cozy place, converted space not very large.

The menu was a lot more German/European than I had expected, and they were just starting their Octoberfest menu.  That being said, there were some wonderful choices.  It’s very often the case that I’ll peruse a menu and find only a couple of things that interest me.  Here there were probably 6 or 7 that sounded really good.  I decided on a roasted duck with plums, which was phenomenal.  Our other entree was a beef stroganoff dish, hot and rich and creamy.

Nice wine list, and very reasonably priced, which always make me happy.

Service was excellent, attentive, polite, quick.  

They brought us some complimentary champagne for our anniversary which was a very nice touch.  

It was a great evening, highly recommended!

data.title: Expect European Taste and Dining Experience
data.text:
Own your table for the night, as is done in Europe. You're entering a time-warp, so leave impatience outside. And dine with superb quality food and kind, willing staff. Top-notch food-October means German specialities and if you lie Roulade and red cabbage and pastries from The Old World...look no further. Flaws include a minimum of meat in some soups and entrees, and some of it tough. Staff seemed, on this night, scattered over several tables and extremely busy, causing frustration in requesting something. Extensive alcoholic beverage list. Reservations mandatory-this is a small, extremely popular restaurant, and bets for professionals and old friends getting togethe...If you've eaten in Europe, you'll appreciate this local treasure.
My husband and I dined here a couple of years ago, about four times, and experienced a similar situation. But overall, wonderful and worth every penny.

data.title: Fantastic, Unique Food
data.text: My wife and I have been here many times, and it's always excellent. They serve high quality, European (German/Swiss) food that is plated very well. The atmosphere is quiet and romantic, and there is always something new on the menu. They roll a dessert cart around to your table after dinner, but I would recommend ordering either the Crème Brulee or Chocolate Lava Tort from the kitchen. One of the best restaurants in the area.

data.title: Large portions, cafeteria quality
data.text:
This restaurant is popular with the locals but not so for us. It was very noisy inside and we found it hard to converse. The schnitzels were OK, the fries tasted as though they had been cooked long before and kept heated. The desserts looked very unappealing with paper stuck to the sides of the sliced cakes to stop them drying out. 

Overall the food was dull, stodgy and not well presented.

data.title: On my way back north
data.text:
Found this in AAA Book. It was just a stop on 1000 miles route. And it was great. A touch of 'old Europe". My sis who lives in Europe and just visited Austria a month ago, admitted the food was perfect. Thou (our -0.5 points) too salty. 
there is a little mix of not only Austrian/German bur french cuisine as well (escargot/snail-these were delicious). Where the h... is sausages and cabbage?? Had no time to compare, but would recommend

user_location.name: New York, New York, United States

data.title: Great Food & Service
data.text: I started the meal with a bowl of lentil/Bacon soup.  the flavor was incredible. For the main course I enjoyed the Dijon crusted lamb; it was outstanding.  For desert, the fresh fruit tort was suggested, it was an excellent suggestion.  It wasn't overly sweet, the fresh fruit really came out.  It was all in all a very good meal.  I'd definitely go back.

data.title: Best food in town!!
data.text: For those of you that haven't recently been to Main Street Eatery, you are missing out on some wonderful dishes, including their Oktoberfest menu! The restaurant's atmosphere is sophisticated, but at the the same time, family friendly. Did I mention service? Main Street has an exceptional staff, that literally understands your needs before you do. Kudos to Urs and Michelle for bringing excellence to Lynchburg dining, and to Wendy and the staff for their professionalism.

data.title: Fancy Eats with a little attitude
data.text:
I've eaten at Main Street Eatery many times since it opened. For me, it is more of a special occasion spot because the price point is a little higher than my usual weeknight out meal. Yes, it is a place with atmosphere and ambience. 

The food is generally very good. I was extremely disappointed in the mussels that were a special offering when I visited last. The special was all you can eat and there were four preparations. I ate my way through all four and didn't find any that I particularly was enthralled with. Each one was flawed by thin watery broth and the mussels themselves were not enhanced in any way. I can chalk that up to a bad night or a bad choice on my part (though I dearly love mussels).

Overall - it's a great place for a delicious dessert and great glass of wine. It is the perfect spot for sweet young couples to gaze into each other's eyes while sharing something chocolate and decadent. I think that the food is good, just might take itself too seriously sometimes!

Solid choice for nice dinner. But be prepared to drop a little $$.

data.title: Awesome!!
data.text: We stepped into this place just by chance.  It was awesome.  My hubby said the best salad he ever had.  Everyone's dinner was very good, also the desserts, YUM.  Also our server was very friendly and knowledgable.  We will definitely be back.

data.title: Good interesting food, friendly service.
data.text: We went on a Monday evening for dinner because the menu looked a bit different and reviews were good. I started with an appetiser of rabbit liver (I did say it was different) which came with a creamy onion sauce and was delicious. Then I had a beef stroganoff and my wife had Wiener schnitzel which were both very good. Wine by the glass was limited but the Sauvignon Blanc and Zinfandel were both very acceptable. Service was friendly and efficient. Well worth a visit.

data.title: Made with Love
data.text: Wow!! Main Street Eatery is amazing... The service was fantastic and the food was out of this world. My boyfriend ordered the New York strip and I ordered the meatloaf... Both meals were absolutely mind blowing, packed with flavor and zest! All and all, this place is one of the best in all Lynchburg! Thank you for making our birthday celebration a success!!

data.title: Very special place!
data.text: Wonderful atmosphere, delicious food, and fantastic waiter. We wanted a special place to celebrate our anniversary while visiting Lynchburg. Main St Eatery delivered! Love how they transformed a men's clothing store into a beautiful restaurant. Loved our waiter!

data.title: Mussels and frites.
data.text:
Mussel night was great. Good service, not a long wait. Good desert.
Beer was a little pricey.
Overall a memorable experience.

data.title: Lynchburg's Culinary Gem
data.text: Never disappoints! I have had a few firsts here. Escargot. Rabbit liver. Amazingly cooked and decadent. For the less adventurous there are plenty of other options that will allow you to taste it again for the first time. Enjoy!

data.title: A Lovely Little Restaurant in the Heart of downtown Lynchburg.
data.text: This was my second visit to the Main Street Eatery and I will surely be returning.  First visit was with my husband and the visit today was with a total of 6 people.  Service was attentive and accommodating, food was very good -- very ample portions -- and atmosphere is lovely.

data.title: Casual European Dining  in Lynchburg
data.text: Fine European style dining in a casual atmosphere- all the German specialties and many other choices.  The servers are friendly and knowledgeable.  Try something new- you'll love it.  The desserts are beautiful and tasty.  Full bar.  Not cheap but good price for what you get.  My favorite- they have unlimited mussels mid-week- call and ask.  Parking might be a problem- it is limited to street parking but it is more likely to be wide open mid-week.

data.title: Where is the Veal and the Professionalism?
data.text:
I ordered the veal.  The meal came on a very hot plate, so hot that I had to wait some time to begin eating it.  After a few bites of mushroom and potato, (where was the veal?) my tongue and mouth began burning from the amount of pepper in it.  I told the waitress and she returned it to the kitchen.  They adjusted the sauce and returned it to me with my half eaten potatoes.  Ugh, a fine restaurant replaces everything on the plate before returning it to the client.  And by the way, the waitress made a  point of telling me that the chef tasted my meal and did not agree with me that it was too peppery.
   Very, very, little veal was included in the meal.  It would have been better named as "Mushroom and onion stew with bits of veal."  Our waitress disappeared after that and she never came to our table again.  It seemed as though it was the bartender who came and asked if we were finished. At that time, I said that I objected to paying top price for veal, which was mainly mushrooms and onions.  She very snappishly said "we will take care of it," and proceeded to angrily take our dishes away. They did not charge me for my meal, but I was embarrassed and humiliated.  I couldn't wait to leave.  Where was the manager and where was the chef?  In a quality restaurant they would have both been to my table immediately upon a complaint. 
   On the other hand, my husband ordered the expensive lamb and was very pleased with the quantity and taste.  So order well and don't complain, and you might be happy.

data.title: Excellent service, great atmosphere, good food
data.text: We found the Main Street eatery by accident-- we were looking for somewhere special to eat for our anniversary.  We had passed Main Street Eatery, and decided to try it.  As we were ushered to our table, we walked by the dessert cart and decided we would definitely be staying for that!  Sara waited on us, and was pleasant and friendly.  When she found out it was our anniversary, she brought us complimentary sparking cider (they also have a champagne option, and their wine list is extensive).  She answered several questions we had about the food, decor, etc.  Big Band music was playing, and apparently that is a nightly thing.  The newer decor boasts brick interior walls with mirrors hanging everywhere, and updated benches with throw pillows.  The menu changes often, depending on what the chef can get fresh, and the desserts are absolutely fabulous!  We ordered the seafood crepes--rich, savory, and buttery-- and the steak frites-- tender, grass-fed beef with rosemary butter.  The desserts topped it all!  We had a hard time deciding, but finally we split the Chocolate Loving Spoonful-- more than enough for two and absolutely delicious.  We went home full and happy, eager to return soon.

data.title: Marvelous Martinis and Mahi Mahi
data.text: We remembered the old Emil's from earlier trips to Lynchburg and were thrilled to visit the more recent downtown incarnation of the restaurant, the Main Street Eatery. The elegant, welcoming ambience drew us inside, and the wait staff - many of whom have been with the owners for years - attended to our every need. A large perfect martini arrived from the bar along with a Rob Roy for my appreciative husband. We ordered the mahi mahi and the duck with pomegranate demi-glace, both of which were extraordinarily delicious. Dessert is not to be missed, as pastries are a specialty of the house, and the arrival of the European style dessert cart is a cause for celebration. We look forward to our next visit to this lovely restaurant.
